englishTranslationText: The	excessively	insulting	one,	spreader	of	spite.
romanUrduTranslationText: Bahut	t’āne	dene	wāla	bahut	idhar	ki	udhar	lagāta	phirne	wāla

englishTranslationText: One	who	excessively	forbids	the	good,	transgressor,	sinner.
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalāi	se	badā	rokne	wāla	had	se	badhne	wāla	guneh-gār

englishTranslationText: Foul	mouthed,	and	in	addition	to	all	this,	of	improper	lineage.
romanUrduTranslationText: Durusht	khu	is	sab	par	turra	yeh	ke	uski	asl	meiñ	khata

englishTranslationText:
Because	he*	has	some	wealth	and	sons.		
(*Walid	bin	Mugaira,	who	cursed	the	Holy	Prophet.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	par	ke	kuchh	māl	aur	bete	rakhta	hai.

arabicText: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText: When	Our	verses	are	recited	to	him,	he	says,	“These	are	stories	of	earlier	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	us	par	hamāri	āayateiñ	padhi	jāyeñ	kehta	hai	agloñ	ki	kahāniyañ	haiñ

englishTranslationText: We	will	soon	singe	his	pig-nose.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qareeb	hai	ke	ham	uski	sowar	ki	si	thootni	
par	dāgh	laga	deñge

arabicText: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	tested	them	the	way	We	
had	tested	the	owners	of	the	garden	when	
they	swore	that	they	would	reap	its	
harvest	the	next	morning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	unheiñ	jāñcha	jaisa	us	
bāgh	waloñ	ko	jāñcha	tha	jab	unhoñ	ne	
qasam	khāyi	ke	zaroor	subah	hote	uske	
khet	kāt	leñge

englishTranslationText: And	they	did	not	say,	“If	Allah	wills”.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Insha	Allah	na	kahā

arabicText: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	an	envoy	from	your	Lord	completed	his	
round	upon	the	garden,	whilst	they	were	
sleeping.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	par	tere	Rab	ki	taraf	se	ek	pheri	
karne	wāla	phera	kar	gaya	aur	woh	sote	
they

englishTranslationText: So	in	the	morning	it	became	as	if	harvested.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	subah	reh	gaya	jaise	phal	toota	huwa

englishTranslationText:
They	then	called	out	to	each	other	at	
daybreak.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	unhoñ	ne	subah	hote	āapas	meiñ	ek	
doosre	ko	pukāra

arabicText: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
That,	“Go	to	your	fields	at	early	morn,	if	you	
want	to	harvest.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	tadke	(Subah	sawere)	apni	kheti	ko	
chalo	agar	tumheiñ	kātni	hai.

englishTranslationText:
So	they	went	off,	while	whispering	to	one	
another.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	chale	aur	āapas	meiñ	āahista	āahista	
kehte	jāte	they.

arabicText: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“Make	sure	that	no	needy	person	enters	
your	garden	this	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	hargiz	āaj	koi	miskeen	tumhāre	bāgh	
meiñ	āane	na	pāaye.

englishTranslationText:
And	they	left	at	early	morn,	assuming	they	
were	in	control	of	their	purpose.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tadke	chale	apne	is	irāde	par	qudrat	
samajhte

englishTranslationText:
Then	when	they	saw	it,	they	said,	“We	have	
indeed	strayed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	usey	dekha	bole	be-shak	ham	rāsta	
bahek	gaye

englishTranslationText: “In	fact,	we	are	unfortunate.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	ham	be-naseeb	huwe

arabicText: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	best	among	them	said,	“Did	I	not	tell	
you,	‘Why	do	you	not	proclaim	His	
purity?’”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	jo	sab	se	ghanimat	tha	bola	kya	
maiñ	tum	se	nahi	kehta	tha	ke	tasbeeh	
kyuñ	nahi	karte

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Purity	is	to	our	Lord	–	we	have	
indeed	been	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	pāki	hai	hamāre	Rab	ko be-shak	ham	
zālim	they

englishTranslationText: So	they	came	towards	each	other,	blaming.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ab	ek	doosre	ki	taraf	malāmat	karta	
mutawajjeh	huwa

englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Woe	to	us	-	we	were	indeed	
rebellious.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	hāaye	kharābi	hamāri be-shak	ham	sarkash	they

arabicText: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًۭا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Hopefully,	our	Lord	will	give	us	a	better	replacement	than	this	-	we	now	incline	towards	our	
Lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ummeed	hai	ke	hameiñ	hamāra	Rab	is	se	behtar	badla	de	ham	apne	Rab	ki	taraf	raghbat	lāte	haiñ

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Such	is	the	punishment;	and	indeed	the	punishment	of	the	Hereafter	is	the	greatest,	if	only	they	
knew!
romanUrduTranslationText: Mār	aisi	hoti	hai	aur	be-shak	āakhirat	ki	mār	sab	se	badi	kya	achchha	tha	agar	woh	jānte

arabicText: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	for	the	pious,	with	their	Lord,	are	Gardens	of	Serenity.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	dar	waloñ		ke	liye	unke	Rab	ke	pās	chain	ke	bāgh	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Shall	We	equate	the	Muslims	to	the	guilty?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	ham	Musalmanoñ	ko mujrimoñ	ka	sa	kar	deñ

englishTranslationText: What	is	the	matter	with	you?	What	sort	of	a	judgement	you	impose!
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheiñ	kya	huwa	kaisa	ḥukm	lagāte	ho

englishTranslationText: Is	there	a	Book	for	you,	from	which	you	read?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	tumhāre	liye	koi	kitāb	hai	jis	meiñ	padhte	ho

englishTranslationText: That	for	you	in	it	is	whatever	you	like?
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	tumhāre	liye	us	meiñ	jo	tum	pasand	karo.

arabicText: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	is	it	that	you	have	a	covenant	from	Us,	right	up	to	the	Day	of	Judgement,	that	you	will	get	all	
what	you	claim?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	tumhāre	liye	ham	par	kuch	qasameiñ	haiñ	Qiyamat	tak	pahuñchti	huyi	ke	tumheiñ	milega	jo	
kuch	d’awa	karte	ho

englishTranslationText: Ask	them,	who	among	them	is	a	guarantor	for	it?
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	unse	poochho	un	meiñ	kaun	sa	iska	zāmeen	hai

arabicText: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	is	it	that	they	have	partners	in	worship?	So	they	should	bring	their	appointed	partners,	if	they	
are	truthful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ya	unke	pās	kuchh	shareek	haiñ	to	apne	shareekoñ	ko	lekar	āayeñ	agar	sachche	haiñ

arabicText: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍۢ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	the	Shin*	will	be	exposed	and	they	will	be	called	to	prostrate	themselves,	they	
will	be	unable.	(Used	as	a	metaphor)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	ek	sāq	kholi	jāyegi	(jiske	m’ana	Allah	hi	jānta	hai)	aur	sajde	ko	bulaye	jāyeñ	ge	to	na	kar	
sakeñge

arabicText: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌۭ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
With	lowered	eyes,	disgrace	overcoming	
them;	and	indeed	they	used	to	be	called	to	
prostrate	themselves	whilst	they	were	
healthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Neechi	nigaheiñ	kiye	huwe	un	par	khwāri	
chadh	rahi	hogi	aur	be-shak		duniya	meiñ	
sajde	ke	liye bulāye	jāte	they	jab	tandrust	
they

arabicText: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	leave	the	one	who	denies	this	
matter,	to	Me;	We	shall	soon	steadily	take	them	
away,	from	a	place	they	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jo	is	bāt	ko	jhutlāta	hai	usey	mujh	par	
chhod	do	qareeb	hai	ke	ham	unheiñ	
āahista	āahista	le	jāyeñ	ge	jahāñ	se	unheiñ	
khabar	na	hogi

englishTranslationText:
And	I	will	give	them	respite;	indeed	My	
plan	is	very	solid.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	unheiñ	dheel	dooñga	be-shak		
meri	khufya	tadbeer	bahut	pakki	hai

arabicText: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًۭا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍۢ مُّثْقَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	is	it	that	you	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	ask	any	fee	from	them,	so	they	are	
burdened	with	the	penalty?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	tum	unse	kuch	ujrat	māñgte	ho	ke	woh	
chatti	ke	bojh	meiñ	dabe	haiñ

englishTranslationText:
Or	that	they	possess	the	hidden,	so	they	
are	writing	it?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	unke	pās	ghaib	hai	ke	woh	likh	rahe	
haiñ

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	wait	for	your	Lord’s	command,	
and	do	not	be	like	the	one	of	the	fish;	who	
cried	out	when	he	was	distraught.	(Prophet	
Yunus	-	peace	be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	apne	Rab	ke	ḥukm	ka	intezār	karo	
aur	us	machli	wāle	ki	tarah	na	hona	jab	is	
hāl	meiñ	pukāra	ke	uska	dil	ghut	raha	tha

arabicText: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Were	it	not	for	his	Lord’s	favour	that	
reached	him,	he	would	have	surely	been	
cast	onto	the	desolate	land,	reproached.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	uske	Rab	k	ne'mat	uski	khabar	ko	na	
pahuñch	jāti	to	zaroor	maidān	par	pheñk	
diya	jāta	ilzām	diya	huwa

englishTranslationText:
His	Lord	therefore	chose	him	and	made	
him	among	those	deserving	His	proximity.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	usey	uske	Rab	ne	chun	liya	aur	apne	
qurb-e-khās	ke	saza-	wāron	meiñ	kar	liya.

arabicText: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	the	disbelievers	seem	as	if	they	
would	topple	you	with	their	evil	gaze	when	
they	hear	the	Qur’an,	and	they	say,	“He	is	
indeed	insane.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	kāfir	to	aise	m’aloom	hote	haiñ	
ke	goya	apni	bad-nazar	laga	kar	tumheiñ		
gira	deñge	jab	Qur’ān	sunte	haiñ	aur	kehte	
haiñ	yeh	zaroor	aql	se	door	haiñ.

englishTranslationText:
Whereas	it	is	not	but	an	advice	to	the	
entire	creation!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	to	nahi	magar	nasihat	sāre	jahān	
ke	liye

englishTranslationText: The	true	event!
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	Haq	hone	wāli

englishTranslationText: How	tremendous	is	the	true	event!
romanUrduTranslationText: Kaisi	woh	haq	hone	wāli

englishTranslationText: And	what	have	you	understood,	how	tremendous	the	true	event	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	ne	kya	jāna	kaisi	woh	haq	hone	wāli

englishTranslationText: The	tribes	of	Thamud	and	A’ad	denied	the	event	of	great	dismay.	(The	Day	of	Resurrection)
romanUrduTranslationText: Samood	aur	Āad	ne	is	sakht	sadma	dene	wāli	ko	jhutlāya.

englishTranslationText: So	regarding	the	Thamud,	they	were	destroyed	by	a	terrible	scream.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Samood	to	halāk	kiye	gaye	had	se	guzri	huyi	chinghād	se
